page.title: 13SCARCLIFFE PARK.
page.content: The wood in Scarcliffe Park covers 900 acres. There are two small ponds, each covering about one acre, and a small stream, the River Poulter, runs through. The wood is owned by the {Chatsworth Estates.}There are many public paths but some of the wood is private. The wood is used for growing {timber}which is constantly cut down and replanted. The wood is also a game preserve for{pheasant, partridge,duck and{rabbits. Three{foresters,}two{gamekeepers and three or four{casual keepers}work in the wood. The only people who live in the wood are the gamekeeper and his family. To move the timber around tractors and trailers are used and a van is used by the gamekeeper. The wood is not greatly used by the public but some visit in summer.
